definitions.definition: angry and aggressive in a way that is frightening

examples.text: Two fierce eyes glared at them.
She spoke in a fierce whisper.

definitions.definition: showing strong feelings or a lot of activity, often in a way that is violent

examples.text: He launched a fierce attack on the Democrats.
Competition from abroad has become fiercer in the last few years.
His wife is his fiercest critic.
The bill was passed despite fierce opposition.

definitions.definition: very strong in a way that could cause damage

examples.text: the fierce heat of the flames
I sure do miss you something fierce!

wordOrigin: Middle English: from Old French fiers ‘fierce, brave, proud’, from Latin ferus ‘untamed’.
